content.description: The main face of the darker section of the Bank. The route trends left with good gear in horizontal slots.  Finishes through the awesome double hueco at the top.
First bolted route on the main (sunny) wall of the Bank.  Just around the corner from Gold Digger.  Begin on thin techy moves for the first two bolts leading to much easier climbing to the top.
content.location: Left most route on the wall

content.description: An easy first 15 feet leads to a tricky move that begins a sequence of fantastic face climbing.  Climb up to the roof and get a shake, pull the roof and continue up continually engaging climbing to the anchors.
content.location: Bolted line Starting left of the right trending crack of "C Note".

content.description: Bolted line right of Bull Market.  Begin on moderate climbing up to a crux out left of bolt line, watch your falls here.  continue up through fun sustained 5.11 climbing to the chains
Begins on a big jug on the corner.  Move back and forth around the corner looking for the big hand holds and big feat.
content.location: First bolted route climbers left at the Bank.  It is in a shady corner, left of the main face.

content.description: Obvious (But dirty) crack about 50 feet right of C-Note.  Not much detail known
content.location: Walk climbers right past c-note and look for an obvious crack in the face.

content.description: A nice route that looks unprotected from the ground.  But it’s all there and solid.  Start on some blocky stuff with a small tree growing out of the rock.  Trend a little left down low, then fire straight up on horizontals.
content.location: Start just left of a tree about 15ft right of the left facing corner route.

content.description: Begin on large right trending flare and keep working right until you find anchors
content.location: Right of last bolted line at The Bank

content.description: Crack right before the big cave.  Not much beta known
content.location: Walk past c-note and look for crack right before big cave.

content.description: Begin on a slab up to good gear in a horizontal before the wall goes vertical.  Long and reachy moves without gear for a bit make for commiting, fun, but risky climbing above a slab.  Chains out right of top ledge.
content.protection: Gear + Anchors to the right of top out ledge

content.description: Scramble up 15' to the first bolt, make a long move to a jug before a dyno to a jug. Enjoy fun movement up and through the roofs. Get your slab stand up game on for the finishing move just below the anchors. Finishes with a great view of the gorge.
content.location: Right of the big double hueco feature, rides the right side of it

content.description: This is an extension to an old Jonesy sport line.  Climb the beautiful face up to the first anchors, this is the real physical crux, the route climbs right of the bolt line.  After the first anchors follow ledgey roofs through good stances and an exposed final roof pull to one of the best views at the Guest.
content.location: Bolted line in the middle of the Bank

content.description: The Bank is a crag with decent, and great rock, with nearly all day sun.  It has a decent mix of sport and trad routes, all worth climbing.
